text: Nicholas Kiplagat Bett (27 January 1990 â€“ 8 August 2018) was a Kenyan track and field athlete who competed in the 400 metres hurdles. His personal best for the event is 47.79 seconds. He was a world champion in the event, having won in 2015 and a two-time bronze medallist at the African Championships in Athletics. He was born in Uasin Gishu County, Kenya. ==Death== Bett was killed in a car crash in Nandi Hills, Kenya on 8 August 2018, aged 28. ==References== Category:1990 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Road accident deaths Category:Kenyan athletes Category:Olympians for Kenya Category:Sprinters Category:Hurdlers Category:Competitors at the 2016 Summer Olympics
title: Nicholas Bett
